item.title: 英国风力发电量再创新高 天气警告仍未解除
item.description: 周二，英国风力发电量创下新纪录，因为强劲的阵风促使英国部分地区发布了天气预警。【原文：UK wind power output reached a fresh record on Tuesday as strong gusts prompted weather warnings across parts of the country.】

item.title: 欧盟与南美的贸易协定为何终于有望达成？
item.description: 欧盟和南美国家花了超过四分之一个世纪的时间试图就自由贸易达成协议。今年，随着全球最大贸易伙伴美国和中国之间迫在眉睫的贸易战，谈判变得更加紧迫，这也促使其他地区寻求新的商业伙伴关系，以缓解贸易战带来的冲击。【原文：The European Union and South American nations have spent more than a quarter of a century trying to strike a deal on free trade. The negotiations took on new urgency this year as a looming trade war between the world’s biggest trading partners — the US and China — spurred other regions to seek out new commercial partnerships to soften the blow.】

item.title: 马斯达尔支持的可再生能源开发商酝酿在阿布扎比上市
item.description: Infinity Power 是马斯达尔公司（Masdar）拥有部分股权的一家可再生能源开发商，据其董事长称，该公司正考虑在未来两三年内在阿布扎比证券交易所出售其股票。【原文：Infinity Power, a renewable energy developer partly owned by Masdar, is considering selling its shares on the Abu Dhabi stock exchange within the next two or three years, according to its chairman.】

item.title: 多亏了中国，我们的燃煤量比以往任何时候都多
item.description:
对世界上污染最严重的化石燃料需求下降的预测为时尚早。【原文：

Predictions of declining demand for the world’s most polluting fossil fuel are premature.

】

item.title: 国际能源署（IEA）称，到 2027 年，煤炭需求将继续刷新纪录
item.description: 国际能源机构（International Energy Agency）的数据显示，至少在2027年之前，全球煤炭需求量每年都将创下新纪录，推翻了此前关于煤炭需求量在去年达到顶峰的估计，凸显了限制导致全球变暖的排放所面临的挑战。【原文：Global demand for coal is set to hit fresh records every year through at least 2027, International Energy Agency data show, overturning a previous estimate that it peaked last year, highlighting the challenges to limiting emissions that cause global warming.】

item.title: 英国监管机构称劳埃德银行的低碳 LinkedIn 广告误导了消费者
item.description:
广告标准管理局称英国银行就其在能源转型方面的努力发布了误导性声明。【原文：

Advertising Standards Authority says British bank published misleading claims about its efforts in the energy transition.

】

item.title: 拜登的绿色银行被监督机构敦促停止新贷款工作
item.description: 美国能源部的独立监督机构在发现利益冲突管理不当后，建议该机构价值 4000 亿美元的绿色银行停止贷款工作。【原文：The US Energy Department’s independent watchdog is recommending the agency’s $400 billion green bank stop work on loans after finding improper management of conflicts of interest.】

item.title: 马克龙将于周四访问遭受飓风袭击的马约特岛
item.description: 据法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙办公室称，法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙将于周四前往马约特岛，此前热带气旋 "希多 "摧毁了这块法国海外领地。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron will be in Mayotte on Thursday, after tropical cyclone Chido devastated the French overseas territory, according to his office.】

item.title: 聚变技术领导者英联邦计划建造首座商业工厂
item.description: 联邦聚变系统有限责任公司（Commonwealth Fusion Systems LLC）是聚变能开发竞赛中的佼佼者，该公司已为其首个商业规模的发电厂租赁了场地，这表明该公司有信心建立一个利用恒星能量的系统。【原文：Commonwealth Fusion Systems LLC, a leader in the race to develop fusion power, has leased a site for its first commercial-scale power plant in a sign of confidence that it can build a system harnessing the energy of the stars.】

item.title: 拜登的液化天然气出口研究为特朗普带来 "减速带
item.description: 拜登政府周二发布了一份重要研究报告，该报告可能会使当选总统唐纳德-特朗普迅速批准更多液化天然气出口的计划变得更加复杂。【原文：The Biden administration released a key study Tuesday that is likely to complicate President-elect Donald Trump’s plans to quickly approve more exports of liquefied natural gas.】

item.title: 研究称北美电网停电风险正在上升
item.description: 据电网可靠性监管机构的一份报告称，由于电力需求激增和化石燃料发电厂的关闭，未来十年北美大部分地区停电的风险将增加。【原文：The risk of blackouts will increase for most of North America over the coming decade due to surging electricity demand and the closing of fossil-fuel power plants, according to a report by a grid reliability regulator.】

item.title: 巨型货轮装上风帆，努力减少碳排放
item.description: 一艘巨大的矿石运输船已成为迄今为止利用风能的最大船只，这是该行业为减少燃料费和碳排放量所做努力的又一小步。【原文：An enormous ore carrier has become the largest vessel yet to harness the wind, another baby step in the industry’s efforts to cut its fuel bills and carbon emissions.】

item.title: 美国立法者可能将乙醇措施纳入支出法案
item.description: 美国乙醇生产商可能即将从国会获得绿灯，在全国范围内销售更高浓度的玉米生物燃料。【原文：US ethanol producers may be on the brink of getting the green light from Congress to sell higher blends of their corn-based biofuel nationwide, a long-elusive goal that the industry considers crucial to its future.】

item.title: 特朗普准备 "在数秒内 "发布刺激钻井的命令
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普准备在 1 月 20 日就职后立即下令进行改革，以鼓励国内石油和天然气开发。【原文：US President-elect Donald Trump is poised to order changes meant to encourage domestic oil and gas development immediately after his Jan. 20 inauguration.】

item.title: 极端天气频发，加州再现野火风险
item.description:
仍在燃烧的马里布大火附近将刮起圣安娜大风，而北加州即将面临另一条大气河流。【原文：

Santa Ana winds to pick up near still-smoldering Malibu fire, while Northern California is about to face another atmospheric river.

】

item.title: PG&E 获得拜登绿色银行提供的 150 亿美元贷款
item.description: 拜登政府正在向 PG&E 公司提供高达 150 亿美元的贷款，用于包括升级水力发电、电池储存和输电线路在内的项目组合。【原文：The Biden administration is offering PG&E Corp. a loan of up to $15 billion for a portfolio of projects that includes upgraded hydropower generation, battery storage and transmission lines.】

item.title: 煤炭黑天鹅威胁绿色转型
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将探讨急剧增长的电力需求将如何进一步扰乱 2025 年的绿色转型。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读全文。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at at how dramatically increasing power demands will further disrupt the green transition in 2025. You can read the full story on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 天气衍生品在不可预测的气候中蓬勃发展
item.description: 随着全球气候变得越来越不稳定，依赖于可预测天气的企业正在转向金融产品，以便在出现热浪、干旱或异常持续降雨时为他们提供补偿。【原文：As the world’s climate becomes increasingly volatile, businesses that depend on predictable weather are turning to financial products that compensate them when there’s a heat wave, a drought or an unusually persistent bout of rain.】

item.title: 假日出行租用电动汽车的四点建议
item.description:
从何时要求换乘，到如何进行简单的启动汽车操作，这就是如何确保旅行顺利进行的方法。

item.title: 欧盟面临修改《环境、社会和治理投资规则》的内部压力
item.description: 一个为欧盟委员会提供咨询的机构建议修改欧盟具有里程碑意义的可持续投资框架，以使投资者更容易了解他们购买的是哪类产品。【原文：A body advising the European Commission has recommended changes to the EU’s landmark sustainable investment framework to make it easier for investors to understand what kinds of products they’re buying.】

item.title: 波兰中央银行呼吁银行评估气候变化风险
item.description: 波兰中央银行呼吁该国的贷款机构评估其所面临的气候变化风险，因为一些公司在减少碳排放方面可能会遇到困难。【原文：Poland’s central bank has called on the country’s lenders to assess their exposure to climate change risks, as some companies may struggle with reducing their carbon emissions.】

item.title: 瑞士监察机构在遭到反驳后发布银行气候风险规则
item.description: 瑞士金融监管机构 Finma 发布了关于银行和保险公司应如何处理与自然和气候变化有关的风险的指导方针，提出了环保人士和业界都有争议的期望。【原文：Switzerland’s financial regulator Finma published guidelines on how banks and insurers should handle risks related to nature and climate change, setting down expectations which have been contested both by environmentalists and the industry.】

item.title: 波兰电力公司 Tauron 计划 2030 年退出煤炭行业，资本支出 250 亿美元
item.description: 随着这个欧盟最依赖煤炭的国家加快能源转型，波兰第二大电力公司 Tauron Polska Energia SA 谋求在本十年末避开燃煤机组。【原文：Poland’s second-biggest power utility Tauron Polska Energia SA seeks to shun its coal-fired units by the end of this decade as the European Union’s most coal-reliant country speeds up energy transition.】

item.title: 肯尼亚计划通过试管婴儿拯救濒临灭绝的珍稀白犀牛
item.description: 肯尼亚计划利用辅助繁殖技术拯救濒临灭绝的北方白犀牛；这一物种在全世界仅存两头雌性。【原文：Kenya plans to use assisted reproduction techniques to save the northern white rhino — a species that has only two females remaining worldwide — from the brink of extinction.】

item.title: 瑞银债务换自然背后的银行家成立信贷基金
item.description: 拉姆齐-伊萨（Ramzi Issa）曾是瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）的资深银行家，因首创债转股而闻名，随着对此类交易的需求升温，他成立了自己的信贷基金。【原文：Ramzi Issa, a former senior banker at UBS Group AG best known for his role in pioneering debt-for-nature swaps, has set up his own credit fund as demand for such deals heats up.】

item.title: 瓦努阿图地震后可能出现危险的海啸波
item.description: 瓦努阿图群岛发生初步震级为 7.4 级的地震，可能引发危险的海啸。【原文：Hazardous tsunami waves are possible after an earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.4 struck the Vanuatu Islands.】

item.title: 力拓和必和必拓在建设 "绿色 "炼铁厂方面迈出新步伐
item.description: 世界顶级矿商必和必拓集团（BHP Group）和力拓集团（Rio Tinto Group）将联合博思格钢铁有限公司（BlueScope Steel Ltd.）建造澳大利亚最大的电炼铁炉，并称此举可加快钢铁生产的去碳化进程。【原文：The world’s top miners BHP Group and Rio Tinto Group will join BlueScope Steel Ltd. to build Australia’s largest electric iron-making furnace, a move they say may speed the decarbonization of steel production.】

item.title: 气候变化偷走了数周的冬季，令滑雪场业主不安
item.description:
全球零度以下的天数正在减少，这迫使企业主做出调整。【原文：

The number of days below freezing is dwindling across the globe, forcing business owners to adapt. 

】

item.title: 英国警告又有近百万房产面临洪水风险
item.description: 英格兰面临洪水风险的房产比以前想象的多出近一百万处，这引发了人们对未来几十年内越来越多的房产无法投保或无法出售的担忧。【原文：Almost a million more properties in England are at risk of flooding than previously thought, raising concerns about a growing number of uninsurable or unsellable properties over the coming decades.】

item.title: 英国政府被指违法允许污水外溢
item.description: 一家公共监督机构周二表示，英国政府和监管机构允许自来水公司即使在不下雨的情况下也向支流倾倒未经处理的污水，这违反了法律，同时威胁要向法院提起诉讼。【原文：The UK government and regulators broke the law by allowing water companies to dump raw sewage into tributaries even when it wasn’t raining, a public watchdog said Tuesday while threatening court action.】
